(1)

Seventh Avenue South, at N. E. corner of Perry Street, showing in background St. Vincent's Hospital.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer. March 15, 1932.

(2)

Seventh Avenue South, at N. E. corner of Perry Street.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer. February 18, 1933.

(1)

Seventh Avenue South, at N. E. corner of Perry Street, showing in background St. Vincent's Hospital.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer. March 15, 1932.

(2)

Seventh Avenue South, at N. E. corner of Perry Street.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer. February 18, 1933.

10 to 4 Perry Street, south side, between Seventh Avenue South and Greenwich Avenue. The balance of the block, to and including the S.E. corner of Waverly Place, was destroyed when Seventh Avenue South was cut through in 1915. The wedge-shaped apartment house at No. 12 was built after 1920.
No. 10 was the residence of the late Thomas M. Mulry; President of the Emigrant Savings Bank and of the United States Society of St. Vincent de Paul, hence the name Mulry Square for the beginning of Seventh Avenue at Greenwich Avenue and 11th Street.
Perry Street was first known as Ogden Street (1803), then as Henry Street (1811); it took its present name in 1813.
March 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

A more extensive view. The additional structures are No. 55 Greenwich Street (at the S.W. corner) and No. 2 Perry Street (adjoining the latter).

P. L. Sperr.

August 3, 1937.

10 to 4 Perry Street, south side, between Seventh Avenue South and Greenwich Avenue. The balance of the block, to and including the S.E. corner of Waverly Place, was destroyed when Seventh Avenue South was cut through in 1915. The wedge-shaped apartment house at No. 12 was built after 1920.
No. 10 was the residence of the late Thomas M. Mulry; President of the Emigrant Savings Bank and of the United States Society of St. Vincent de Paul, hence the name Mulry Square for the beginning of Seventh Avenue at Greenwich Avenue and 11th Street.
Perry Street was first known as Ogden Street (1803), then as Henry Street (1811); it took its present name in 1813.
March 15, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

A more extensive view. The additional structures are No. 55 Greenwich Street (at the S.W. corner) and No. 2 Perry Street (adjoining the latter).

P. L. Sperr.

August 3, 1937.

Seventh Avenue South, east side, from Perry to 11th Streets.
May 19, 1933.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

1-Seventh Avenue at the northeast corner of Perry Street.

2- Seventh Avenue, north side, at intersection Greenwich Avenue, showing Sheridan Square Theatre on the left and St. Vincents Hospital on right looking north.

P. L. Sperr
View 1: August 12, 1939
View 2: March 18, 1933

1-Seventh Avenue at the northeast corner of Perry Street.

2- Seventh Avenue, north side, at intersection Greenwich Avenue, showing Sheridan Square Theatre on the left and St. Vincents Hospital on right looking north.

P. L. Sperr
View 1: August 12, 1939
View 2: March 18, 1933

(1) Perry Street, south side, west from Seventh Ave. Extension to West 4th Street, showing prominently two 5-story tenements (Nos. 26 and 28) and a row of 3-story dwellings (Nos. 30 to 40). West of the latter are two more 5-story buildings (Nos. 42 and 44) which adjoin another 3-story structure (No. 46).

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same in an eastward direction as viewed from West 4th Street. The structure on the right is No. 52 (also No. 261 West 4th Street) and is at the S.E. corner.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Perry Street, south side, west from Seventh Ave. Extension to West 4th Street, showing prominently two 5-story tenements (Nos. 26 and 28) and a row of 3-story dwellings (Nos. 30 to 40). West of the latter are two more 5-story buildings (Nos. 42 and 44) which adjoin another 3-story structure (No. 46).

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same in an eastward direction as viewed from West 4th Street. The structure on the right is No. 52 (also No. 261 West 4th Street) and is at the S.E. corner.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
